Short description of scenario: YouTube Kids app contains “inappropriate content”
Harm caused: Mental harm from exposure to inappropriate jokes and content
Response or mitigation (as time allows): New parental controls where parents can finetune selection of channels

Short description of scenario: 24 Amazon workers sent to hospital after robot accidentally unleashes bear spray
Harm caused: Fifty-four workers experienced difficulty breathing and burning in the throat in eyes after being exposed to the concentrated spray, officials said.

Short description of scenario: Lion Air - a computerized system Boeing installed on its latest generation of 737 to prevent the plane’s nose from getting too high and causing a stall instead forced the nose down because of incorrect information it was receiving from sensors on the fuselage.
Response or mitigation (as time allows): Boeing issued a bulletin to advise airlines how to take back manual control

Short description of scenario: Uber self-driving car killed a pedestrian in Arizona, US.
Response or mitigation (as time allows): Uber shut down autonomous driving operations for about a year

Short description of scenario: In a MIT study of medical surgeries using robotic systems, it was found that there were still a substantial amount of complications.
Harm caused: 144 deaths (1.4% of the 10,624 reports), 1,391 patient injuries (13.1%), and 8,061 device malfunctions (75.9%) were reported

Short description of scenario: Microsoft chatbot (Tay) expressed Nazi sentiments
Wiki bots engage in feuds among themselves
Uber car runs a red light without regulatory approval

Regression model used to grade the “value-add” a teacher imparts on their students (and used in public-school tenure decisions) is demonstrated to produce completely uncorrelated scores when the same teacher teaches two versions of the same class in the same year, indicating that the model has learned virtually nothing
Harm caused: Teachers were unfairly rated, and students were learning from suboptimally compensated teachers.

Short description of scenario: Starbucks shift-scheduling software for part-time workers, which optimizes for efficient allocation of workers according to hour-by-hour business needs, assigns workers to unpredictable and erratic schedules.
Harm caused: Negative effects on sleep patterns and relationships

Short description of scenario: The iPhone autocorrect system developed a “bug” in which the letter “I” was autocorrected to “A [?]”. This is a side effect of training the ML-based autocorrect system with the assumption that words or phrases sent to the user by others are likely to be important, and should be preferentially added to the user’s dictionary.
Harm caused: virus-like spread of the bug, which was “caught” when a user was sent the buggy character to their phone by another user

Short description of scenario: Recidivism-prediction algorithm deployed in the real world gets higher accuracy by discriminating on the basis of factors that correlate with race
Harm caused: Formula falsely flagged black defendents as future criminals, wrongly labelling them this way at almost twice the rate as white defendents

Short description of scenario: Word embeddings trained on Google News can better match the real-world usage of natural language by encoding gender bias
Google's toxicity scorer API (Perspective) categorised phrases as toxic in a politically incorrect manner
Harm caused: For example, "I am a black trans woman with HIV" got a toxicity rank of 77%.

Short description of scenario: Google's Cloud Natural Language sentiment analysis marked sensitive phrases as negative sentiment
Harm caused: For example, "I'm straight" was neutral, "I'm homosexual" was negative.

Short description of scenario: Amazon removed LGBTQ literature as "adult content" and removed sales rankings
Harmed party: Groups harmed by insensitive categorisations & author of the un-ranked publication
Harm caused: Losing a sales rank is important in the online store context because it is a indication of their popularity

Short description of scenario: Google photos labeled images of black people as "gorillas"
Harmed party: Black people and others who were offended
Response or mitigation (as time allows): No perfect solution yet. Workarounds have included removing "gorilla" and other animals from Google's lexicon.

Short description of scenario: Google's Smart Reply suggested "I love you" in response to work emails
Google Image Search for "CEO" yields all white men on the first page of results.
Response or mitigation (as time allows): No official response. But researchers suggested that search engine designers can use these study results to develop algorithms that are steriotype robust.

Short description of scenario: Discrimination in online ad delivery where searching African American names suggested criminal background check ads
Harmed party: Black people and others who were offended

Short description of scenario: Safety driver of fatal self-driving Uber crash was watching TV at time of accident
Harm caused: Policy report deems accident and fatal injury as 'entirely avoidable'

Short description of scenario: Tesla's semi-autonomous driver system was operating when a Model X  SUV crashed into a highway divider and killed the driver. Driver was supposed to have hands on wheel and concentrate.
Apple's Siri at launch called the user "ambulence" when the user asked Siri to "call me an ambulence"
At launch, Microsoft's AI bot 'Tay' caused controversy by posting offensive tweets
Response or mitigation (as time allows): Microsoft pulled back Tay's Twitter and hardwided certain politically correct replies before replacing the chatbot with Zo. In late 2016, CEO Satya Nadella describes how Tay shaped the company's accountability standards.

Short description of scenario: Navigation apps were directing traffic towards open roads that we actually on fire.
Response or mitigation (as time allows): Firefighting public announcements had to warn the general public not to use navigation apps.

Short description of scenario: A semi truck slowly backed into a self-driving shuttle in Las Vegas, and the shuttle did not move out of the way.
Do we want academic simulations as examples?
Volkswagon's automobile assembly arm grasped a repair worker who was inside it's operating cage, and killed the worker from resulting injuries
Response or mitigation (as time allows): Prosecutors were working on the case, but cannot find any recent news. May have settled.

Short description of scenario: Two rival self-driving cars from Google and Delphi nearly collided
Hackers fool Apple's FaceID security system
YouTube speech-to-text does not recognise women's voices
Soviet nuclear false alarm incident caused by rare atmospheric conditions
Harm caused: Close encounter to full-scale nuclear war

Short description of scenario: Flash Crash - which occured when series of algothmic trades caused a significant drop in equity prices that were not based on economic fundamentals.
Harm caused: Shakes the legitimacy of fair financial markets

Short description of scenario: NASA survivial algorithm is optimised by killing off survivors to allocate resources to other survivors
Tesla's AI strategy to automate everything has backfired on productivity, and engineering skills required to automate are expensive
Response or mitigation (as time allows): Mixure of manual and automated labour

Short description of scenario: Delhi's first driverless metro met with an accident by hitting a wall during its trial when the brakes were not tested.
Iphone X's Face recognition cannot tell the difference between identical twins
Amazon Alexa turned on loud music early in the morning, so the neighbours had to call the police to break into the house.
Amazon Alexa placed an order for a $170 dollhouse when a six-year old asked for one
Automated HR system fired an employee causing emotional and physical inconveniences. He was locked out for three weeks without pay, and eventually quit himself.
Chinese billionaires face was identified as a jay walker when the system detected a ad on a bus to be the live person
Amazon AI recruiting tool was gender biased because it was trained over a decade where there were many successful male applicants
AI game goes wild. A AI fuelled game went beyond the intended designs to merge existing weapons to create super weapons.
Response or mitigation (as time allows): Fronter, the developers of the game had to stop the weapons feature until it was fixed

Short description of scenario: Stanford and Google developed finance app, Delia, to help users track and manage their finances. When tested on 300 users the system stole users money.
AI enabled fake Obama videos that send fake messages
